title: Here's everything new coming to Disney+ in December 2021
text:
Technically, Marvel's Avengers spinoff miniseries “Hawkeye,” starring Jeremy Renner and Hailee Steinfeld, premieres Nov. 24, but four of its six episodes will air in December, with the finale Dec. 22.

And once that's done, it's time for everyone's favorite intergalactic bounty hunter, with the highly anticipated “Mandalorian” spinoff “The Book of Boba Fett” (Dec. 29). The eight-episode series will focus on the seedier side of the “Star Wars” universe, as Boba Fett (Temuera Morrison) and his mercenary friend Fennec Shand (Ming-Na Wen) look to take over the late Jabba the Hutt's criminal empire on Tatooine.

Disney's DIS streaming service will also have the streaming debut of the upcoming animated movie “Encanto” (Dec. 24), just a month after it hits movie theaters. The fantasy musical is already drawing critical raves.

Also see: What's worth streaming in December 2021: ‘The Witcher,' ‘Book of Boba Fett,' ‘Matrix: Resurrections' and more

There's also an all-new, animated version of “Diary of a Wimpy Kid” (Dec. 3); the nature-exploration docuseries “Welcome to Earth” (Dec. 8), featuring Will Smith; “Foodtastic” (Dec. 15), a food-sculpture competition series hosted by Keke Palmer; and “The Rescue” (Dec. 3), a NatGeo documentary about the dramatic rescue of Thai children from a deep cave in 2018.

And more: What's coming in December to Hulu | Amazon Prime Video | HBO Max | Disney+

Disney+ also has a ton of holiday offerings, including “Home Alone,” “High School Musical: The Musical: The Holiday Special,” “The Muppet Christmas Carol” and “Tim Burton's The Nightmare Before Christmas, as well as a slate of animated shorts and a collection of Christmas-themed “The Simpsons” episodes.

Here's the complete list of what's on tap, as of Nov. 17 (release dates are subject to change):
